data.title: Franklin Leach
data.meta_description: Franklin Leach passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Daily Item on 2014-07-15.
data.text: PORT TREVORTON — Franklin D. Leach, 81, of Port Trevorton, went home to be with his Lord and Savior on Tuesday morning, July 15, 2014, at Geisinger Medical Center, Danville. Franklin was born at home on Dec. 18, 1932, in Chapman Township, Snyder County, a son of the late Frank A. and Mary Jane (Arbogast) Leach. He was married to the former Vivian M. Mengle, who survives. They celebrated 62 years of marriage. He attended Arnold’s grammar schoolhouse. Franklin retired from Hempt Bros., Camp Hill, and also worked for Chapman Township and later served one term as a township supervisor. He was a member of Richfield Mennonite Church. Franklin enjoyed gardening, woodworking, camping, traveling and spending time with his family, especially his grandchildren and great-grandchildren. In addition to his loving wife, Franklin is survived by one son and daughter-in-law, Donald E. and Marjorie Leach, of Mifflinburg; three grandchildren, Daniel E. Leach and his wife, Brandy, Jean L. Bingaman and her husband, Pastor Jesse, and Patty A. Bingaman and her husband, Myron, all of Mifflinburg; 10 great-grandchildren, Nathaniel, Noah, Hannah, Grace, Sarah, Levi, Joy, Jocelyn, Abigail and Makayla; one brother and sister-in-law, Kenneth and Martha Leach, of Mifflinburg; three sisters and one brother-in-law, Almera Stahl, of Mount Pleasant Mills, Eileen Bowersox, of Northumberland, and Mary Lou and Ray Smith, of Red Lion; and many nieces and nephews. Franklin was preceded by two sisters, Helen Feaster and Kathryn Mench, and two brothers-in-law, Grant Stahl and Paul Bowersox. Friends and family are invited to the visitation from 10 to 11 a.m. Friday at Richfield Mennonite Church, 167 Church St., Richfield, followed by the funeral at 11 with Pastor Aaron Benner officiating. Burial will be in Grubbs Cemetery, Mount Pleasant Mills. Should friends desire, memorial gifts may be made to Franklin’s church. The George P. Garman Funeral Homes Inc., 9366 Route 35, Mount Pleasant Mills, has been entrusted with the arrangements.
